comments:
Dear Eclipse folks,

I had a previous installation of Eclipse 2.x and removed the eclipse 
installation dir as well as the workspace dir. After upgrading to 3.0.1 I get 
the following error after the splash screen. Env is Solaris 9 with Gnome 2.0.

Running with "-vm /usr/j2sdk1.4.2_04/bin/java" (which used to run Eclipse 2.x 
perfectly well) didn't help either.

example$ eclipse -debug           
Start VM: /usr/bin/java
-cp /opt/eclipse/startup.jar org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main
-os solaris
-ws motif
-arch sparc
-showsplash /opt/eclipse/eclipse -showsplash 600
-exitdata /opt/eclipse/eclipse -exitdata 2e1001
-debug
-vm /usr/bin/java
-vmargs
-cp /opt/eclipse/startup.jar org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main

Um, turns out to be a permissions issue...

The directory <eclipse-dir>/configuration and its contents must be writable by 
the user(s) running eclipse.
